oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bob McDill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1977 Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Bob McDill. The recording takes place on 11-17-77.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bob McDill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:07) -- Bob Allen mentions an article written about Bob McDill's writing habits. Bob Allen asks about Bob McDill's transition from writing rock n' roll to country music. (2:01) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill whether he took other jobs early on in Memphis when songwriting. (2:58) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill when he first decided to write music full time. (4:48) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about coming to Nashville with Jack Clement. (6:41) -- Bob Allen asks whether Bob McDill got discouraged when first beginning songwriting. (8:55) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his daytime songwriting habits. (12:00) -- Bob Allen discusses with Bob McDill about the "Kristofferson Myth" and Hank Williams give songwriting a false, reckless romantic image. (12:35) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his personal listening habits. Bob McDill says he doesn't listen to country stations so he doesn't compete mentally with other great songwriters. (16:10) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his daily writing quota. (17:46) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about the evolution of writing a song. (19:52) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his ability to gauge whether a song will become a hit or an average album cut. (21:17) -- Bob McDill discusses pitching his own songs. (22:01) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill whether he has ambitions to write prose. (Referencing Bob McDill's liner notes on a Bobby Bare album). (24:15) -- Bob McDill discusses that he believes lyricism is an underappreciated artform. (25:45) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about how he personally integrates melodies and lyrics. (28:04) -- Bob Allen asks whether Bob McDill ever writes music at home. (28:56) -- Bob Allen asks why Bob McDill turned down recording contracts in the past. (30:32) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill how many years he's lived in Nashville. (30:55) -- Bob McDill discusses being chosen as 'Songwriter of the Year'.
